japanese: あっ、お兄ちゃん。
translation: Ah, big bro.

japanese: こんなところでなにしてるんだ？
translation: What are you guys up to?

japanese:
なにってわけじゃなくて、
波打ち際で休憩ってところ？
translation:
Nothing really,
we're just at the beach and relaxing.

japanese:
水が透き通ってて、どこまでも続いてる。
この景色はいくら眺めていても飽きないよ。
translation:
The water is crystal clear and continues beyond the horizon.
This view never gets boring
no matter how long you look at it.

japanese:
そういえば、どうして沖縄の海は
こんなに綺麗なのかな？
地元の海とは全然違って見える。
translation:
Come to think of it, why is the Okinawan ocean
so beautiful? It looks so different
from the sea at home.

japanese:
海ってもっと色が暗いイメージがあったんだけど、
沖縄の海は透明だね。
translation:
I always had the impression
that the sea is darker in color,
but the ocean in Okinawa is so transparent.

japanese:
確かに透明だよね。
濁りが全然ない。
translation:
That's right, it's completely transparent.
There is no murkiness at all.

japanese:
この辺りは、プランクトンといった不純物が
少ないかららしいぞ。
translation:
Apparently, there are fewer impurities,
such as plankton, in this area.

japanese:
黒潮が流れ込んでくる影響で
海にプランクトンの餌になる有機物が少ないんだ。
translation:
It's because of the Kuroshio Current bringing 
in less organic matter at it flows in. That organic
matter is the food source for plankton in the sea.

japanese:
プランクトンの餌？
どういうこと？
translation:
The food source for plankton?
What do you mean?

japanese:
あー、つまりだな、黒潮は海流の名前だが
この海流は栄養素が少ない。
栄養がないからプランクトンが多くは生きられない。
translation:
Well, Kuroshio is the name of the ocean current and
it carries only a few nutrients.
Without nutrients plankton is unable to reproduce.

japanese:
不純物になるプランクトンが少ないから
海が透明になる――
これでわかるか？
translation:
In other words: if there are fewer impurities from plankton,
the sea becomes transparent...
Do you get it now?

japanese:
うん、なんとなくわかった。
さすがお兄ちゃん、物知りだね。
translation:
Yeah, I kind of get it.
As expected, big bro. You know a lot.

japanese: あとはサンゴも理由らしいよ。
translation: Also, apparently corals are another reason.

japanese: サンゴ？
translation: Corals?

japanese:
この辺りはサンゴがたくさん生息してて、
その浄化作用で海水が綺麗になるんだって。
translation:
This area has a lot of corals.
The seawater is cleaned by the purifying effect of the coral.

japanese:
あと、サンゴが死んだあとは海底の白い砂になって、
それが太陽の光を反射するおかげでもあるらしいよ。
translation:
And after the coral dies,
it turns into white sand on the seabed,
which apparently reflects the sunlight.

japanese: そうなのか、砂になるくだりは知らなかった。
translation:
Is that so? I didn't know that 
corals are responsible for the white sand.

japanese:
一花、詳しいじゃないか。
調べてきたのか？
translation:
Ichika, you know your stuff.
Did you look that up?

japanese:
ううん、実はね、さっき浮き輪を借りたところの
インストラクターさんが教えてくれたんだよ。
translation:
No, actually, the instructor
who just lent me the float told me that.

japanese:
聞いたばかりだから覚えてただけで、
前から知ってたわけじゃないんだ。
translation:
I just heard it so I remembered it.
Not because I knew it beforehand.

japanese:
でも、関心があるから覚えたんだろ？
教えてもらっても興味のないことは覚えないはずだ。
translation:
But you remembered it because you were interested,
right? You wouldn't remember something you're not interested 
in, even if someone shared this info with you.

japanese:
あはは！
さすが先生は褒め上手。
人の気分を乗せる方法を心得てますなぁ。
translation:
Ahaha!
As usual, you're good at giving compliments, Sensei.
You know how to lift people's mood.

japanese:
もう先生じゃないぞ。
家庭教師は終了したからな。
translation:
I'm not your teacher anymore, you know.
Your home tutoring is over.

japanese:
そんなのわかってるよ。
いまのは言葉のアヤってやつ。
translation:
I know that.
I was just teasing you.

japanese:
フータロー君、細かいところにこだわりすぎ。
そういう男はモテないぞ？
translation:
Futaro-kun, you're too nitpicky.
Guys like that won't get popular, you know?

japanese:
って、そうかモテなくても問題ないんだ。
二乃がいるもんねー。
translation:
Though, it's not a problem even if you're unpopular.
With Nino by your side, huh.

japanese: でも、それで二乃さんに嫌われちゃったら大変だよ！
translation: But, it'll be a problem if Nino-san starts hating you!

japanese:
大丈夫、二乃の愛はそれくらいじゃ冷めたりしないよ。
姉である私が保証しましょう。
translation:
It's okay, Nino's love won't cool off that easily.
As her older sister, I guarantee it.

japanese: お前ら、勝手に話を進めるんじゃない。
translation: Just stop making things up.

japanese:
なんにせよ、君は良い先生だったよ。
おかげで私も卒業できたわけだし。
translation:
Anyway, you were a good teacher.
Thanks to you, I was able to graduate.

japanese: そう言ってもらえると教師冥利に尽きる。
translation:
That's the greatest reward a teacher could ask for,
to hear a student say that.

japanese:
まあ、密かな特技だ。
お前らのおかげで身についた。
translation:
Guess it's a secret talent of mine.
I learned it because of you guys.

japanese:
んー？
特技って言うには、
ちょっとまだ不完全なんじゃない？
translation:
Hmm?
I think it's rather a talent in development, isn't it?

japanese:
私たちは、なんとなーく君の言いたいことが
わかるけど――
translation:
Do you really think you have the natural talent to teach other
people?

japanese:
果たして私たち以外を相手にした時、
特技として通じるかな？
translation:
I wonder if your talent would work
with someone else?

japanese:
そもそも、親しい相手以外を
褒めるようなことはしない。
translation:
I mean, I wouldn't just praise someone
without knowing them well.

japanese:
相手のことを知らなければ、
ただのお世辞になっちまうだろ？
translation:
If you don't know the person you're talking to it's just 
flattery, right?

japanese:
うーわ。
それを冗談抜きで言える辺り、
フータロー君て意外とタラシだよねぇ。
translation:
Holy moly.
You're taking this way too seriously. Don't be such a dork.

japanese: なんでだ！？
translation: What?!

japanese:
なんにせよ、君は良い先生だったよ。
おかげで私も卒業できたわけだし。
translation:
Anyway, you were a good teacher.
Thanks to you, I was able to graduate.

japanese: そう言ってもらえると教師冥利に尽きる。
translation:
That's the greatest reward a teacher could ask for,
to hear a student say that.

japanese:
先生役はこりごりだ。
自分の勉強時間が短くなるし、
予想外のことが起こりすぎて対応しきれん。
translation:
I'm tired of being a teacher.
It cuts into my study time, and unexpected things
keep happening that I can't handle.

japanese:
またまた。
顔には、悪くなかったって書いてあるよ？
translation:
Oh, really?
I always had the impression that you liked it...?

japanese:
ま、まあ、そうだな。
振り返ってみると実のあるバイトではあった。
translation:
Well, yeah, I guess when I look back on it,
it was a job worth doing.

japanese: 二乃さんにも出会えたんだもんね～。
translation: And you've also met Nino-san.

japanese: そ、それも、まあ……。
translation: W-well, that's true, yeah...

japanese:
なんにせよ、君は良い先生だったよ。
おかげで私も卒業できたわけだし。
translation:
Anyway, you were a good teacher.
Thanks to you, I was able to graduate.

japanese: そう言ってもらえると教師冥利に尽きる。
translation:
That's the greatest reward a teacher could ask for,
to hear a student say that.

japanese:
まあ、生徒に手を出した
不良先生でもあるわけだけど？
translation:
Still, it's true that you're some kind of maniac
who lays his hands on students, though, right?

japanese: ぶはっ！
translation: WOAH!

japanese:
おま、お前、言い方があるだろ！
生徒に手を出したって！
translation:
Hey, you could say it
a little better than that!
A maniac who lays his hands on students?!

japanese: 間違ってないよね？
translation: Isn't that true?

japanese:
間違ってないが！
まるで俺が犯罪者じゃねぇか、それじゃ！
translation:
Well, it's not wrong!
But it makes me sound like a criminal!

japanese: でもね、フータロー君には本当に感謝してる。
translation: But, really, I'm grateful that you helped us Futaro-kun.

japanese:
君、言ってたじゃない？
高校生活で青春をエンジョイってさ。
translation:
You said you wanted to enjoy your high school life,
didn't you?

japanese: ……最初に言ったのはお前だ。
translation: ...You said it first though.

japanese:
そうだけど……
本当にそんな高校生活を送れるなんて、
思ってなかったんだよね。
translation:
Yeah, but...
I didn't expect we could've
such fulfilling high school days.

japanese:
だけど、君のおかげで、私たちは
かけがえのない高校生活を送ることができた。
translation:
Thanks to you,
we were able to experience something irreplaceable.

japanese: ありがと、フータロー君。
translation: Thank you, Futaro-kun.

japanese:
いや、改まって言われるとなんだか……
どういたしまして。
translation:
No, no, it's weird being praised like that...
But, you're welcome.

japanese:
お兄ちゃんがこんな風に
褒められる日が来るなんて……！
translation:
I never thought that someone would praise you like this
big bro...!

japanese:
あのな、らいは。
お前、俺のことをなんだと思ってるんだ。
translation:
Wait, Raiha.
Do you think I'm a dork?

japanese:
勉強はできるけど友達が少ない、
人とのコミュニケーションも苦手な困ったお兄ちゃん。
translation:
You're a very good student, who has very few friends and you 
can barely communicate. Big bro, YOU are a dork.

japanese: ……まあ、友達が少ないのは認めるが。
translation: ...Well, I'll admit to having few friends.

japanese: 認めちゃうんだ、そこ。
translation: You admit that, do you.

japanese:
う、うるさい。
それでも、まったくいないってわけじゃ
ないんだからな！？
translation:
Zip it!
Anyway, I still have some friends, you know?!

japanese:
フータロー君はどんな時もフータロー君だね。
そういうところも嫌いじゃないよ。
translation:
Futaro-kun, you're always the same,
no matter what. I like that about you.
